etymology.description: 王 (surname Wang) + 老 (honorific ‘venerable/old’) + 吉 (auspicious) = “Venerable Lucky Wang,” used as a brand name.
etymology.interpretation: Combines a family name with an honorific and an auspicious character to signal respectability and good fortune. Used as the herbal tea brand known in Cantonese as Wong Lo Kat.

parts.english: lucky; auspicious; good fortune; surname Ji

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝王老吉(我喜歡喝王老吉)。
examples.english: I like to drink Wong Lo Kat.

examples.chinese: 在广东，大家把王老吉叫做凉茶(在廣東，大家把王老吉叫做涼茶)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Guǎngdōng, dàjiā bǎ Wáng Lǎojí jiàozuò liángchá.
examples.english: In Guangdong, people refer to Wong Lo Kat as herbal tea.

examples.chinese: 红罐的王老吉很受欢迎(紅罐的王老吉很受歡迎)。
examples.pinyin: Hóng guàn de Wáng Lǎojí hěn shòu huānyíng.
examples.english: The red-can Wong Lo Kat is very popular.
